result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Jason J Gehrke was found guilty of OWI (4th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due. $100 per mo during extended supervision set by court.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.  No use or possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and in original containers.
Defendant to submit to random testing.

Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment.
Attend VIP

Transcript of: Change of Plea/Sentencing Hearing      8/21/2014      Terri Knowles
for sentencing

Defendant Jason J Gehrke in court with attorney Nathan J. Dineen.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Count 2 dismissed.  Court finds defendant guilty and renders sentence.

to extend time to file pretrial motions - Scanned & forwarded to B1 for review for status hrg at 1:15 pm
to extend time to file pretrial motions

State by ADA Jeffrey Sisley.  Defendant in custody & appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty Dejunco as a friend to the Court.  Counsel advises the defendant will be retaining private counsel.  Court advises the defendant of the penalties.  Court finds good cause to extend time limits for holding of the preliminary hearing to allow defendant time to retain counsel.  State requesting $5000 cash bail w/conditions.  Court orders $2500 cash bail w/conditions:  absolute sobriety; not to operate motor vehicle w/out valid dl; Report to SCRAM w/in 4 business hours of posting bail; no controlled subst/prescrip medic unless prescribed; no minor children in any vehicle operating.  Court orders matter adj to 3/25 at 1:15 pm for status of preliminary hearing.
